City Council

Meetings

Regular Meetings

  • 6:30 pm
  • 2nd and 4th Tuesday of each month (except November and December when meetings are held just the 2nd Tuesday)
  • City Hall
    2671 San Angelo Street
    Ingleside, TX 78362

Citizen Participation during Council Meetings:

Citizen's who sign up to speak during the Citizens Comments and Reports section on the City Council Meeting Agenda may speak for three minutes. Only one citizen may speak at a time. They may speak on any topic listed on the agenda or otherwise. This is not a question-and-answer session, and the council will not respond to questions or issues posed by any speaker. However, council may address certain questions or issues later if they appear on the agenda.

Citizen Participation Forms can be filled out the night of the meeting and presented to the City Secretary. The City Secretary will call each citizen to speak in the order they were received.

Special Meetings

  • Special meetings may be held on the call of the Mayor or three Council Members

Agendas & Minutes

Agendas are available prior to the meetings. Minutes are available following approval.

View Most Recent Agendas and Minutes

City Councilors are elected and represent the city "at large." Council Members serve staggered two-year terms with three members up for reelection each year. The Mayor is also elected at large and serves a two-year term. No Mayor or Council Member may serve more than three consecutive terms, whether partial or complete terms, whether elected or appointed.

Duties

The City Council is the legislative and policy-making body of the City of Ingleside, a "home-rule" city, operating under the authority of the City Charter. The Council enacts legislation, adopts the budget, sets the tax rate, determines policies, approves the appointment of the City Manager, City Attorney, Municipal Court of Record Judge, Municipal Court of Record Clerk, and all Boards and Commission Members.

The City Council receives information from the following groups to decide issues and set policy:

  • Recommendations from City Staff based upon study and analysis
  • Inquiries and information from citizens
  • Decisions and advice from the City Boards and Commissions
  • Professional advisers/consultants as needed
